## ReactSerializer class

Serialize the extension provided schema into a JSX element that can be displayed node and non-dom environments.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class ReactSerializer<GExtension extends AnyExtension = any> 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(nodes, marks, manager)](./react-renderer.reactserializer._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs a new instance of the <code>ReactSerializer</code> class |

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [marks](./react-renderer.reactserializer.marks.md) |  | <code>Record&lt;string, MarkToDOM&gt;</code> |  |
|  [nodes](./react-renderer.reactserializer.nodes.md) |  | <code>Record&lt;string, NodeToDOM&gt;</code> |  |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [fromExtensionManager(manager)](./react-renderer.reactserializer.fromextensionmanager.md) | <code>static</code> | Create a serializer from the extension manager |
|  [renderSpec(structure, wraps)](./react-renderer.reactserializer.renderspec.md) | <code>static</code> | Receives the return value from toDOM defined in the node schema and transforms it into JSX |
|  [serializeFragment(fragment)](./react-renderer.reactserializer.serializefragment.md) |  | The main entry method on this class for traversing through a schema tree and creating JSx.
```ts
reactSerializer.serializeFragment(fragment)

```
 |
|  [serializeMark(mark, inline, wrappedElement)](./react-renderer.reactserializer.serializemark.md) |  | Transform the provided mark into a JSX Element that wraps the current node |
|  [serializeNode(node)](./react-renderer.reactserializer.serializenode.md) |  | Transform the passed in node into a JSX Element |
